citations.narrative:
Acquisition records were not available for the regulated animals at the facility. Multiple chinchilla births had occurred at the
facility, however the information which is required per this section of the AWA had not been documented. Records must
be maintained for all animals in the facility and must be updated with the required information, including date of acquisition
and species of animal and any live births. The documents must be available for review by APHIS officials during
inspections.

A Contingency Plan had been documented for the facility, however it did not contain the required information per this
section of the AWA. The facility must develop and document a contingency plan which describes the care for the animals
in the event of a disaster. The plan must describe events which would trigger the need for implementation, as well as
identify a specific chain of command of who would be responsible for fulfilling the described tasks. The document must be
available for review by APHIS officials during inspections.

The igloo style hideouts in four of the chinchilla enclosures were observed with chewed and jagged edges. The jagged
edges could cause injury to the animals and in addition could harbor debris and prevent efficient cleaning. The enclosures
and housing facilities must be maintained in good repair. Animal enclosures and housing features must be repaired or
replaced as needed in order to comply with this section of the AWA.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by May 25, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
n

narrative:
2.75(b) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Acquisition records were not available for the regulated animals at the facility. Multiple chinchilla births had occurred at the 
facility, however the information which is required per this section of the AWA had not been documented. Records must 
be maintained for all animals in the facility and must be updated with the required information, including date of acquisition 
and species of animal and any live births. The documents must be available for review by APHIS officials during 
inspections. 
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
A Contingency Plan had been documented for the facility, however it did not contain the required information per this 
section of the AWA. The facility must develop and document a contingency plan which describes the care for the animals 
in the event of a disaster. The plan must describe events which would trigger the need for implementation, as well as 
identify a specific chain of command of who would be responsible for fulfilling the described tasks. The document must be 
available for review by APHIS officials during inspections. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The igloo style hideouts in four of the chinchilla enclosures were observed with chewed and jagged edges. The jagged 
edges could cause injury to the animals and in addition could harbor debris and prevent efficient cleaning. The enclosures 
and housing facilities must be maintained in good repair. Animal enclosures and housing features must be repaired or 
replaced as needed in order to comply with this section of the AWA. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by May 25, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.

n

species.common: CONGO AFRICAN GREY PARROT / GRAY PARROT
